TopicTitle: Rover Steering Control Bug on KSC Runways

Articles.Content:
KSP Version: 0.1.0.0.20892

Operating System: Windows 10

CPU: 11th Gen Intel Core i7-11800H @2.30Ghz

GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 Laptop GPU 6 G

RAM: DDR4 3200 MHz 16 Gb

Expected Behavior: Rover continues traveling straight when no steering input is given while coasting or in a straight line.

Observed Behavior: Rover travels straight for a short period of time (maybe 60 seconds?) before veering quickly out of control when no steering input is given. This is occurring with wheels of multiple sizes, under acceleration and while coasting.  The rover always veers the same direction for a given wheel size. If the rover does not flip and control is regained, the rover can travel for another 30-60 seconds before the issue occurs again. These are simple rovers constructed of a RoveMate, single solar panel, and 4 or 6 wheels. Altering wheel settings does not affect the issue.

Steps to Replicate:

1. Construct a simple rover with a RoveMate and (4) XS or S size wheels

2. Launch Rover from KSC Runway

3. Accelerate rover to 8-10 m/s and let coast.

Fixes / Workarounds: Wider wheelbase to avoid flipping when rover inevitably veers out of control. Other fixes not found.
